conclusion: Analyze the motion of charged particles in the velocity selector to determine kinetic energy.
First particle is accelerated by M and enters velocity selector N.
Electric field E and magnetic field B are perpendicular in the selector.
Electric force balances magnetic force for straight line motion: qE = qvB, v = E/B.
Kinetic energy of first particle: E_k = 1/2 mv^2, substituting v = E/B gives E_k = 1/2 mE^2/B^2.
Second particle has mass 2m and charge q, accelerated by M and enters N.
Second particle deviates by distance d due to force imbalance.
Net force on second particle: qE - qv'B = ma.
Acceleration related to deviation: d = 1/2 aL^2, a = 2d/L^2.
Substitute acceleration into force equation: E - v'B = 2md/qL^2, v' = E/B - 2md/qL^2B.
Kinetic energy of second particle: E_k' = mv'^2.
Substitute v' into kinetic energy equation: E_k' = m(E/B - 2md/qL^2B)^2.
Expand kinetic energy equation: E_k' = mE^2/B^2 - 4m^2dE/qL^2B^2 + 4m^3d^2/q^2L^4B^2.
Final kinetic energy of second particle: E_k = mE^2/B^2 - 4m^2dE/qL^2B^2 + 4m^3d^2/q^2L^4B^2.
